0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono: Pediculosis capitis: Apply enough suspension to cover dry scalp, then apply to dry hair; leave on for 10 minutes; rinse off thoroughly with warm water; repeat application if live lice are present 7 days after initial treatment

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono: Pediculosis capitis: (6 months or older) Apply enough suspension to cover dry scalp, then apply to dry hair; leave on for 10 minutes; rinse off thoroughly with warm water; repeat application if live lice are present 7 days after initial treatment

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: specific contraindications have not been determined

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• benzyl alcohol toxicity may occur, especially in infants younger than 6 months due to increased absorption; use not recommended in infants younger than 6 months
  • report suspected adverse reactions to ParaPRO, LLC at 1-855-628-7622 or the US Food and Drug Administration at 1-800-FDA-1088 or www.fda.gov/medwatch

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Spinosad causes neuronal excitation in insects, and in lice, periods of hyperexcitation are followed by paralysis and death. Spinosad is derived from the fermentation of a soil actinomycete bacterium, Saccharopolyspora spinosa. Spinosad topical suspension is a mixture of spinosyn A and spinosyn D in a 5:1 ratio.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
• General Information
    Not for oral, ophthalmic, or intravaginal use
  • Topical
    • Avoid contact with eyes
    • Shake bottle well immediately prior to use
    • Apply enough suspension (up to 120 mL) to cover dry scalp, then apply to dry hair
    • Leave on for 10 minutes, then rinse off thoroughly with warm water
    • Repeat application if live lice are present 7 days after initial treatment

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono: eradication of head lice infestation is indicative of efficacy

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Drug may cause application site reactions (erythema, irritation, dryness, or exfoliation), ocular erythema, and alopecia.
  • Instruct patient to contact physician if live lice are detected 7 days after initial application. A second application may be needed.
